subject: RE: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: This is somewhat off topic, but when I tried doing this I got errors from Eclipse about duplicate files. The problem is my Visual Source Safe files that are
messageBody:
This is somewhat off topic, but when I tried doing this I got errors
from Eclipse about duplicate files. The problem is my Visual Source Safe
files that are left in every directory, and always named the same. Is it
possible to to get Eclipse to ignore duplicate files?

Also, when you specify multiple input directories like this, doesn't
bunch all of your class files from the various directory structures
together? I tend to like to keep my class files in the same directories as
their respective java files, but that's just me...

-tim

-----Original Message-----
From: Dinwiddie, George [mailto:George.Dinwiddie@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2002 3:35 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse


Bill de h√ìra asked:
> Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
> whose junit code is organized as follows:
>
> src/
> java/
> a/b/c
> test/
> a/b/c

Yes, I've got something similar. My organization is actually as follows

project/
classes/
source/
com/...
test/
com/...

In the Resource Perspective, rightclick on the project in the Navigator tree
and select Properties. Select "Java Build Path" on the left and the
"Source" tab on the right. Set the radio button for "Use source folders
contained in the project" and either add or create your source and test
folders.

It works for me, but ask away if this doesn't work or doesn't make sense.

- George
